Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the unemployment rate for African-Americans between the ages of 17 and 20, stating it is 51 percent, while the official unemployment rate is lower at 31.8 percent.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough support for the stated unemployment rate of 51 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide sufficient evidence or data to back up the stated unemployment rate of 51 percent.
Problematic assumption: There is no evidence of a problematic assumption in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of an alternative explanation in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the official unemployment rate for African-Americans between the ages of 17 and 20 is 31.8 percent, not 51 percent.
